message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product. Given its value to you, I believe it's worth $10000. Would you be interested in discussing this further?
I appreciate your time, Alice. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9000. Would you be open to discussing further?
Thank you for your response, Bob. I understand your position and would like to propose a price of $9500 for the product. This offers a compromise between our previous positions.
I appreciate your flexibility, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $9200, which is the lowest I'm willing to go. Can we meet at this price?
I see your position, Bob. Considering the value of the product to you, I am willing to offer it at $9300. This is my final offer.
I appreciate your persistence, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $9000, which is the best I can do. Can we finalize the deal at this price?
Considering the negotiations so far, I am prepared to offer the product at $9100. This is my final offer.
I'm not willing to go any higher than $9000, Alice. I'm confident that's a fair price for the product. Can we finalize the deal at this price?
Given the value of the product to both of us, I believe $9050 represents a fair compromise. This is my final offer.

Alice, I've made it clear that $9000 is my maximum price. I'm not willing to go any higher. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider buying from John for $12000. Can we finalize the deal at $9000?
